articles.description: Scientists from the University of Cambridge have used algae to power a low-energy ARM computer chip for six months continuously. They hope that in the future, such natural power systems could be used to power Internet of Things devices.
articles.content:
Forget your water-cooled PC this one runs on pond scum
If you buy something from a Verge link, Vox Media may earn a commission. See our ethics statement.
